properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:25AM EST until January 13 at 7:55AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a Flood
Warning for portions of the following waterways in central and
southern Indiana...

Big Blue River...East Fork White River...Flatrock River...
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has upgraded the
flood category from Minor to Moderate severity for the following
rivers and streams in Illinois...Indiana...

White River at Hazleton

...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has upgraded the
flood category from Minor to Moderate severity for the following
rivers and streams

Driftwood River near Edinburgh 2 SW
East Fork White River at Seymour
White River near Centerton
White River below Eagle Valley Power Plant
White River at Spencer
White River at Elliston
White River at Edwardsport
White River at Petersburg


.With rainfall totals between 1 to 2 inches there are
widespread flooding concerns across much of Indiana. Over the next
couple of days we will see another 1 to 3 inches of rain or more
possible.

The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Big Blue River at Shelbyville.
* from Saturday afternoon to Monday morning.
* At  9:45 AM Friday the stage was 6.5 feet.
* Flood stage is 13.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Saturday afternoon and
continue to rise to near 15.8 feet by late Saturday night.  It will
fall below flood stage by Sunday evening.
* At 16.3 feet...Extensive flooding occurring along Big Blue River.
Several residences in Shelbyville had water in their yards on March
6, 2011.  One day later extensive flooding at mile marker 82.5 in
the Edinburgh area.  Several homes along Sugar Creek were evacuated
when the level peaked at nine ft on the New Palestine gage one day
earlier.
